title: yelp.com XSS ATO (via login keylogger, link Google account)

profile.name: Yelp
profile.about: Connecting people to great local businesses in communities around the world.

activities.message:
Hi there!

Thanks for submitting your report to us! Please expect a response within a week.

Best,
The Yelp Security Team

Hi there @lil_endian,

Thanks for the detailed report and the very interesting bugs!

We've pushed a fix for this issue for now, and will follow up with further improvements in the coming days.

Best,
Yelp Security

Hi @lil_endian , 

Thank you again for your report. 
We are happy to award you a bounty of $6000. We have deployed the fix and we'd appreciate if you could confirm it on your end as well.

Thanks for helping keep our users safe! We hope you keep banging away on the Yelps, we'd love to see what else you find.

Best,
Yelp Security

Thank you! It seems you fixed it by removing the possibility of setting the `yelpmainpaastacanary` cookie via the `canary` query parameter. The self-xss is still present, but it's useless if an attacker cannot set a cookie value, so this attack is no longer working.
Updating to note that we have also resolved the self-XSS.
